The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is solely related to an unseen and ancient phenomenon: The dust group had gotten involved with possible living fossils… They are long lost kidnappers and now their preacher seeks vengeance.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie was decent produced though.
That being said, as a viewer I was still taken by this classic Disney film when I rewatched it lately: I think one can’t be aware of so many references to fairy tales and mythology that were put in this production.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures in the countless empires that make up the Galaxy beyond. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an homage to both "Miami Vice" and has some elements that pay homage to "Honey I Shrunk the Kids", which was released a few months prior.
Featuring cameos from biggest stars of the 80's such as Martin Kove, Arnold Vosloo
